column1: Table 6. Percent distribution of justice system payrolls, by state and type of government, March 2017
Series title: Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts, 2017 - Preliminary NCJ 300017
Data source: Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts Program (JEEE)
Author: Emily D. Buehler, Ph.D., BJS Statistician
Table 6. Percent distribution of justice system payrolls, by state and type of government, March 2017

column4: Total justice system as a percent of total March payrolls/b
column6: Police protection as a percent of total justice system March payrolls/b
column8: Judicial and legal as a percent of total justice system March payrolls/b
column10: Corrections as a percent of total justice system March payrolls/b

column1: Note: March payroll data may not sum to total because of rounding.

a/Total March payroll includes payrolls of states and all types of local governments, including independent school districts, which are not displayed separately. The "Local, total" lines, which include these districts, will not equal the sum of the "Counties" and "Municipalities" lines.
b/Justice system payrolls of independent school districts and special districts (primarily for special police forces) are not available.
